H0.text: Scale is the tool most useful for determining the length and width of a school cafeteria.

H1.text: A centimeter ruler is the most useful tool for determining the length and width of a school cafeteria.

H2.text: Tape measure is the most useful tool for determining the length and width of a school cafeteria.

H3.text: A thermometer is the most useful tool for determining the length and width of a school cafeteria.

A4.text: The use of millimeter only tape measures for housing construction is a part of the US metric building code.

A5.text: Most tapes sold in the United States are inches- and feet-based.
